bioghist.p: Hugh T. Kerr (1871-1950) was a Presbyterian minister. He was an 1897 graduate of Western Theological Seminary, and was ordained the same year. From 1897 to 1913, he served as pastor in several churches in Pittsburgh, Kansas and Chicago. In 1913 he returned to Pittsburgh in answer to a call from Shadyside Presbyterian Church, where he would remain pastor until retirement in 1946. During World War I, Kerr served as chaplain to several soldiers' training camps in upstate New York. Over the years, Kerr spent some of his time lecturing at various seminaries, and he became a trustee of Washington and Jefferson College. He served as president of the Board of Christian Education from 1923-1941 and was elected Moderator of the General Assembly of the Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A. in 1930.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of colored and black and white glass lantern slides taken in China. Subjects include unidentified missionaries, churches, Chinese buildings, and Chinese people. The collection also includes several slides from Europe, possibly taken during World War I. Images include troops in a train station, a demonstration of artillery, and the Tuileries Gardens entrance with a framework structure for sandbags.
